segment.source: Using Your PIN or Password
segment.target: Using Your PIN or Password

segment.source: BitLocker helps secure your computer by requiring a personal identification number (PIN) or password to unlock the information that is stored on your computer.
segment.target: BitLocker helps secure your computer by requiring a personal identification number (PIN) or password to unlock the information that is stored on your computer.

segment.source: The PIN or password requirements are set by your organization and depend on the kind of drive being encrypted.
segment.target: The PIN or password requirements are set by your organization and depend on the kind of drive being encrypted.

segment.source: Data on the encrypted drives cannot be viewed without entering the PIN or password.
segment.target: Data on the encrypted drives cannot be viewed without entering the PIN or password.

segment.source: If your computer hardware includes an enabled Trusted Platform Module (TPM), the TPM chip prompts you for your PIN before Windows starts on your computer.
segment.target: If your computer hardware includes an enabled Trusted Platform Module (TPM), the TPM chip prompts you for your PIN before Windows starts on your computer.

segment.source: About Your BitLocker PIN and Passwords
segment.target: About Your BitLocker PIN and Passwords

segment.source: Your company specifies the complexity required for your PIN or password.
segment.target: Your company specifies the complexity required for your PIN or password.

segment.source: These requirements for your PIN or password are explained during the BitLocker setup process.
segment.target: These requirements for your PIN or password are explained during the BitLocker setup process.

segment.source: The password is used to unlock drives on your computer that do not contain the operating system.
segment.target: The password is used to unlock drives on your computer that do not contain the operating system.

segment.source: BitLocker will ask for your password after the PIN is requested during startup.
segment.target: BitLocker will ask for your password after the PIN is requested during startup.

segment.source: Each BitLocker protected hard disk on your computer has its own unique password.
segment.target: Each BitLocker protected hard disk on your computer has its own unique password.

segment.source: You cannot unlock a BitLocker protected drive until you provide your password.
segment.target: You cannot unlock a BitLocker protected drive until you provide your password.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Your Help Desk may set drives to unlock automatically.
segment.target: Your Help Desk may set drives to unlock automatically.

segment.source: This eliminates the need to provide a PIN or password to view the information on the drives.
segment.target: This eliminates the need to provide a PIN or password to view the information on the drives.

segment.source: Unlocking Your Computer if You Forget Your PIN or Password
segment.target: Unlocking Your Computer if You Forget Your PIN or Password

segment.source: If you forget your PIN or password, your Help Desk can help you unlock BitLocker protected drives.
segment.target: If you forget your PIN or password, your Help Desk can help you unlock BitLocker protected drives.

segment.source: To unlock a drive protected with BitLocker, contact your Help Desk if you need help.
segment.target: To unlock a drive protected with BitLocker, contact your Help Desk if you need help.

segment.source: How to unlock your computer if you forget your PIN or password
segment.target: How to unlock your computer if you forget your PIN or password

segment.source: When you contact your Help Desk, you will need to provide them with the following information:
segment.target: When you contact your Help Desk, you will need to provide them with the following information:

segment.source: Your user name
segment.target: Your user name

segment.source: Your domain
segment.target: Your domain

segment.source: The first eight digits of your recovery key ID.
segment.target: The first eight digits of your recovery key ID.

segment.source: This is a 32-digit code that BitLocker will display if you forget your PIN or password.
segment.target: This is a 32-digit code that BitLocker will display if you forget your PIN or password.

segment.source: If you forget your PIN, you will have to enter the first eight digits of the recovery key ID, which will appear in the BitLocker Recovery console.
segment.target: If you forget your PIN, you will have to enter the first eight digits of the recovery key ID, which will appear in the BitLocker Recovery console.

segment.source: The BitLocker Recovery console is a pre-Windows screen that will be displayed if you do not enter the correct PIN.
segment.target: The BitLocker Recovery console is a pre-Windows screen that will be displayed if you do not enter the correct PIN.

segment.source: If you forget your password, look for the recovery key ID in the BitLocker Encryption Options Control Panel application.
segment.target: If you forget your password, look for the recovery key ID in the BitLocker Encryption Options Control Panel application.

segment.source: Select Unlock Drive and then click I cannot remember my password.
segment.target: Select Unlock Drive and then click I cannot remember my password.

segment.source: The BitLocker Encryption Options application will then display a recovery key ID that you provide to Help Desk.
segment.target: The BitLocker Encryption Options application will then display a recovery key ID that you provide to Help Desk.

segment.source: Once your Help Desk receives the necessary information, it will provide you with a recovery key over the phone or through e-mail.
segment.target: Once your Help Desk receives the necessary information, it will provide you with a recovery key over the phone or through e-mail.

segment.source: If you forgot your PIN, enter the recovery key in the BitLocker Recovery console to unlock your computer.
segment.target: If you forgot your PIN, enter the recovery key in the BitLocker Recovery console to unlock your computer.

segment.source: If you forgot your password, enter the recovery key in the BitLocker Encryption Options Control Panel application, in the same location where you found the recovery key ID earlier.
segment.target: If you forgot your password, enter the recovery key in the BitLocker Encryption Options Control Panel application, in the same location where you found the recovery key ID earlier.

segment.source: This will unlock the protected hard drive.
segment.target: This will unlock the protected hard drive.

segment.source: Changing your PIN or Password
segment.target: Changing your PIN or Password

segment.source: Before you can change the password on a BitLocker protected drive, you must unlock the drive.
segment.target: Before you can change the password on a BitLocker protected drive, you must unlock the drive.

segment.source: If the drive is not unlocked, select Unlock Drive, and then enter your current password.
segment.target: If the drive is not unlocked, select Unlock Drive, and then enter your current password.

segment.source: As soon as the drive is unlocked, you can select Manage your Password to change your current password.
segment.target: As soon as the drive is unlocked, you can select Manage your Password to change your current password.

segment.source: How to Change your PIN or password
segment.target: How to Change your PIN or password

segment.source: Click Start, and then select Control Panel.
segment.target: Click Start, and then select Control Panel.

segment.source: Control Panel opens in a new window.
segment.target: Control Panel opens in a new window.

segment.source: Select System and Security, and then select BitLocker Encryption Options.
segment.target: Select System and Security, and then select BitLocker Encryption Options.

segment.source: To change your PIN, select Manage Your PIN.
segment.target: To change your PIN, select Manage Your PIN.

segment.source: Type your new PIN into both fields and select Reset PIN.
segment.target: Type your new PIN into both fields and select Reset PIN.

segment.source: To change your password, select Manage Your Password.
segment.target: To change your password, select Manage Your Password.

segment.source: Enter your new password into both fields and select Reset Password.
segment.target: Enter your new password into both fields and select Reset Password.
